subject: Fashion
title: Degendering Retail Spaces
description: Learn Degendering Retail Spaces in one minute.

hook.text: Walk into most clothing stores and you'll see two sides: men's on the left, women's on the right.

buildup.text: This layout dates back to department stores in the 1800s that separated shoppers by gender.

discovery.text: Brands like COS and Selfridges now organize by garment type insteadâ€”coats here, knitwear there.

twist.text: When Selfridges tried 'Agender' in 2015, sales didn't drop. Customers stayed longer in the store.

climax.text: Removing gender signs doesn't confuse shoppers. It actually makes browsing feel more like discovery.

punchline.text: Remove the signs. People still find clothes they love.

quiz.question: What happened when Selfridges tested a gender-neutral store layout?
options: Sales dropped because customers couldn't find their sections
The experiment failed and they reverted within a month
Sales held steady and customers spent more time browsing
